TopicTitle: Now This Is Just Freaky SQUAD

Articles.Content:
I like Merch but not sure about buying pj's with Jebediah on them. Would probably wake up in the middle of the night and find the bed has crashed and caught fire.

Jebediahs Pyjamas
Kerbal comics merch is completely separate from us.

Ahhh... Was at the same URL that I found these... http://www.cafepress.com/KerbalSpaceProgram

I do like this though...

Kerbal Space Program-the T-shirt, Kerbal Space Program-the Coloring Book, Kerbal Space Program-the Lunch box, Kerbal Space Program-the Breakfast Cereal, Kerbal Space Program-the Flame Thrower.

Love the merchandising!! Can't wait for it to arrive so I can brandish it with pride!!*

* also saves on buying multiple copies of the game because you feel guilty about the value/cost ratio.

Edited May 24, 2013 by Rastgen Kerwin

Kerbal Space Program-the T-shirt, Kerbal Space Program-the Coloring Book, Kerbal Space Program-the Lunch box, Kerbal Space Program-the Breakfast Cereal, Kerbal Space Program-the Flame Thrower.

Love the merchandising!! Can't wait for it to arrive so I can brandish it with pride!!

I see your conic patch is as big as mine...
Some Kerbal Guitar picks wouldn't go astray

I'm actually disapointed by the merchandise. Everything is white with some Kerbals on it. I thought you guys would come up with some clever ideas like a mug that has the KSP logo on it so i can feel like the poeple in Houston.
definitely getting a mug and the bumper sticker. I think they should create like small plastic figurines. I never bought any, but god would I love having a Jeb on my desktop.

I'm actually disapointed by the merchandise. Everything is white with some Kerbals on it. I thought you guys would come up with some clever ideas like a mug that has the KSP logo on it so i can feel like the poeple in Houston.

The irony is, the Squad team started out in Marketing.. :) Coffee Mugs with the KSP logo would have been a no-brainer.

The 100 people that walk into my office every day won't ask what the little green aliens on my coffee cup are, but they might ask "Whats the kerbal space program?"
That is awesome

The irony is, the Squad team started out in Marketing.. :) Coffee Mugs with the KSP logo would have been a no-brainer.

The 100 people that walk into my office every day won't ask what the little green aliens on my coffee cup are, but they might ask "Whats the kerbal space program?"

Ummm? http://www.cafepress.com/kerbalspaceprogram.853547905 The logo's on there, it's just on the other side.

http://www.cafepress.com/kerbalspaceprogram.855237191

There is also a mug that just has the logo.

I like the t-shirts and bumper stickers, but you know what I always thought would be a good t- shirt or bumper sticker?

As a matter of fact, I am a rocket scientist!

- Kerbal Space Program

I even thought of making one up for myself at one of those T-shirt printing places...

Edit: I thought I should add, for the benefit of those who's first language is not English, that the term rocket scientist is sometimes used derogatorily.

Edited May 24, 2013 by PakledHostage

Kerbal Space Program-the Coloring Book, Kerbal Space Program-the Lunch box, Kerbal Space Program-the Breakfast Cereal

My 5-year old (well, and me too) would LOVE all three of these!

Just think: a green cereal in the shape of rockets and Kerbals! And boosters could be little marshmellows ... oh the irony.

Ummm? http://www.cafepress.com/kerbalspaceprogram.853547905 The logo's on there, it's just on the other side.

Then I am an Idiot, thank you for pointing it out

C'mon guys... mission patches! I remember suggesting mission patches waaaay back in the dawn of time whenever the possibility of merchandise was suggested.

The coffee mug is cool, though.

C'mon guys... mission patches! I remember suggesting mission patches waaaay back in the dawn of time whenever the possibility of merchandise was suggested.

The coffee mug is cool, though.

Already ordered that one. Considering I drink 2-pots a day, I'm going to be Jeb-bing quite frequently in the next 8 days .

I like the Kerbal comics humour but I've never been much of a fan of the character design. In the game they look like little weird, zany, spaced out cute things, in the comics they sometimes sort of do but have more of a human feel, it's a bit different, and Jeb looks like some 50's greaser trying to pick up women in a bar or something. I don't know, just not how I imagine him.
I hope they'll make a tshirt with this design:

Kerbal Space Program-the T-shirt, Kerbal Space Program-the Coloring Book, Kerbal Space Program-the Lunch box, Kerbal Space Program-the Breakfast Cereal, Kerbal Space Program-the Flame Thrower.

Love the merchandising!! Can't wait for it to arrive so I can brandish it with pride!!*

* also saves on buying multiple copies of the game because you feel guilty about the value/cost ratio.

I would love to have Lunch box.
I sooo want that, it looks hilarious, exept for the chance that you might do a re-entry in a spacesuit.

They really should do a windscreen vinyl of the bumper sticker for those who don't want to stick it onto their brand new sports car (which is what I'm doing). I've got a brand new Vauxhall Astra GTC SRI which I really want to add "AD" to the "ASTRA"... like this...

I hope they'll make a tshirt with this design:

Oh my god!!! I WANT THAT NOW!!! Yes, right now... Give it to me!
Actually that poster looks like "Kerbal Space Program - Haloween Edition" or "Teen Kerbowolf".

Actually that poster looks like "Kerbal Space Program - Haloween Edition" or "Teen Kerbowolf".

I've seen it many months ago here, back when KSP forums was still under Simple Machines.

I forgot which thread though
